alert.note: Alert for Coastal Brazoria; Coastal Harris; Fort Bend; Inland Brazoria; Inland Galveston; Inland Harris; Wharton (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 07 at 5:15PM CDT by NWS Houston - Galveston
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of east central Wharton, west central Galveston, Fort Bend, northern Brazoria and southern Harris Counties through 600 PM CDT... At 515 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from Fulshear to Missouri City to South Belt / Ellington. Movement was south at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Western Pasadena, Pearland, southwestern League City, Sugar Land, Missouri City, Friendswood, Deer Park, Rosenberg, Alvin, Stafford, South Houston, Katy, Santa Fe, Richmond, Manvel, Fresno, South Belt / Ellington, Mission Bend, Town West and Pecan Grove. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.

area.areaDesc: Coastal Brazoria; Coastal Harris; Fort Bend; Inland Brazoria; Inland Galveston; Inland Harris; Wharton
